settings.text:
Typically most of the ponds and lakes across town are all frozen at this time of year, but we have seen a lot of them open up with the recent warm weather and wind. If you find open water to fish in town, be sure to keep your flies small as the water is still plenty cold and the fish will be moving slow. Some flies to try include Mayers mini leech, thin mints, and a jigged slumlord. Be sure to work the flies slow and cover water to find where the fish are at.

Horsetooth Reservoir Report

Most fish in the lake have moved deep with the colder water, but trout can still be found cruising the shorelines near drop offs. Try throwing smaller streamers and leeches when targeting the trout in Horsetooth.

Local Ponds Report

Many of the ponds are starting to open up and there is fishable water to be had across town. Some of these ponds might freeze back up if we have another cold snap but for the time being there are some great opportunities. Be sure to check the regulations of the natural areas because some have certain restrictions, you can check here.

Flies

Bass: Sparkle Minnow, Jawbreaker, Ritt's Fighting Craw, Meat Whistle, Balanced Baitfish, NearNuf Crayfish, Galloup's Nancy P, Thin Mint #6-10, Clouser Minnows

Pike: Barry's Pike Fly, Game Changer, GT Roosta, Sparkle Minnow, EP Minnows, Clouser Minnows, Deceivers

Carp: Headstand, Backstabber, Swimming Nymph, Mayer's Mini Leech, Dirty Monkey, Montana Prince Nymph

We have a Staff Selection of flies for Warmwater Species HERE and Carp HERE

 

Stillwater Trout:

Our trout stillwaters are all frozen over for winter. We are all anxiously waiting for ice off and great lake fishing ahead! We're happy to answer any lake fishing questions you may have, so give us a call if you need any help.

                     North Park Report

All of the lakes in North Park are now frozen for the winter.

Plains Lakes Reports

Alsop, Gelatt, Twin Buttes, Leazenby, and Lake Hattie all are frozen for the season. Unfortunately Meeboer had a significant fish kill, read more about it here.

Honholz Lakes Reports

All 3 of the Honholz Lakes are capped with ice.

Red Feather Lakes Reports

West Lake, Dowdy Lake, Parvin Lake and Lake Bellaire all have ice on them.

Highway 14 Alpine Lakes

Joe Wright, Chambers, and  Barnes Meadow have all completely frozen up for the season. Lake Agnes and Longdraw are completely frozen.

Flies

Trout: Balanced leech #10, Juju Chironimid #12-16, Chironocone #12-16, Flash Back Scud #14-18, Mayers Mini Leech, Crystal Chironomid #12-16,Thin Mint #6-12, Ritt's Fighting Craw

Current Streamflow :  497 cfs @ Grey Reef, 532 cfs @ Miracle Mile

The flows on both the Miracle Mile and Grey Reef have remained steady over the last few weeks. Both sections of river will remain around 500-600 cfs through the colder months. Midges and baetis can be seen hatching on the North Platte throughout the winter months. In addition to these small bugs there are plenty of scuds, leeches, worms, and eggs in the river year round, so definitely give them a try as well. Having a larger, heavier lead fly with a smaller midge trailing is a great way to fish the Platte in the winter. Make sure to have some additional weight on your nymph rigs to get your flies down to the fish in some of the deeper holes. Nymphing has been the most productive way to find some fish, but streamers can also be very effective. Streamers such as a geisha girl, sparkle minnow, and slump busters have been working well. The conditions up north will be changing by the day, so be sure to swing by the shop or give us a call if you have any questions!

Nymphs:  Juju Baetis #18-22, Sparkle Wing RS2 #18-#20, Olive Two-bit Hooker #18, Split Foam Back #18-#22, WD-40 #18-22, Mayhem Midge #18-20, Theo's Melting Pot Midge #18-22,  Mohair Leech Black/ Wine #10-14, Sparkle Worm #10, Annelid #14-18, Otter Egg #12-14, Gabriels Trumpet #10-16, Girdle Bug/Rubber Legs Stone #8-12, Flossy Worm, IED #10

Dries:  Para Adams #18-24, Sprout Midge #18-22  Griffith Gnat #18-#20, Para Wulf Adams #18-22, Erics High Vis Midge #20-22, Mole Fly #18-22, ARF Midge #20-22, Film Critic BWO #18-22, Ext. Body BWO #18-22

Streamers:  Dungeons, Rusty Trombones, Platte River Spider,  Goldies, Peanut Envys, Thin-Mint #8-12, Sparkle Minnow #4-6, Rubber Bugger Yellow/Brown #4, Platte River Special, Ish's Snitch
The 2023 season on the Cache La Poudre was an absolute blast!  If you have any questions about guide trips please contact us at 970-498-8968.
